description: A one-semester survey of Islamic art and architecture which will examine visual culture as it functions within the larger sphere of Islamic culture in general. Particular attention will be given to relationships between visual culture and literature, using specific case studies, sites or objects which may be related to various branches of Islamic literature, including historical,didactic, philosophical writings, poetry and religious texts. All primary sources will be available in English translation.
name: INTRO VIS CULT ISLAM WLD: Visual Culture of the Islamic World

values.name: INTRO VIS CULT ISLAM WLD: Visual Culture of the Islamic World
